results.title: An Unmarried woman
results.creator_credit: Fox, Paul Mazursky and Tony Ray
results.brief_description: Jill Clayburgh and Alan Bates star in this excellent production depicting the reconstruction of a life, as Clayburgh struggles to find herself after her husband leaves her for another woman. Torn between conflicting forces, her lovers and her daughter, Clayburgh learns to take control of her life. This film became a beacon for the Women’s Movement in the 1970’s.

results.title: An Unfinished piece for mechanical piano
results.brief_description: Platonov is thirty-five and believes he is a failure. Caught between ex-lovers at a wealthy widow’s estate, he recalls youthful ideas while facing present reality. This sparkling adaptation is based on Chekhov’s first play ‘Platonov’, and it reveals the essence of the writer’s tragi-comic world. An outstanding cast of leading Russian actors makes it the most idiomatic of all Chekhov films. Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: An Officer and a gentleman
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lorimar Film Entertainment, Martin Elfand and Taylor Hackford
results.brief_description: Taylor Hackford (Against all odds, Proof of life) directed “An Officer and a gentleman”, starring Richard Gere and Debra Winger. It is the story of Zack Mayo (Gere) a man of uncertain future who is in conflict with his identity. A life of familial instability has left Zack unwilling to engage emotionally with others, especially women. Zack determines that he favours a career as a navy pilot, largely to prove to his alcoholic father that he is a son worthy of respect and capable of achievement. His steely demeanour suits military life but is in part broken down by his romance with a local factory girl Paula Pokrifi (Winger). Life in the armed forces is depicted as brutal and inhumane as the recruits make their way through a gruelling 13-week course. Foley, (Louis Gossett, Jnr) the irascible Major in charge of the recruits, rides Mayo particularly hard as he recognises in him Officer material. Mayo is torn between his cold conduct that shelters him from feeling anything and his burgeoning love for Paula. “An Officer and a gentleman” won Oscars for Gosset (Best Supporting Actor) and Best Song for “Up where we belong”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount Pictures, Lorimar Film Entertainment, Martin Elfand and Taylor Hackford

results.title: An Indecent obsession
results.brief_description: As World War II draws to a close, Ward X is a haven for a group of emotionally wounded men and their warm, sensitive nurse, Sister Langtry. However, peace can be shattered so easily and this is the story of a woman’s obsession to duty, and the obsession she unwittingly nurtures in the men she cares for - an obsession that is inescapable. Starring Wendy Hughes.

results.title: An American werewolf in London [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lycanthrope Films, George Folsey Jr and John Landis
results.brief_description: David and Jack are two American backpackers off for a three-month trek of Europe. Whilst wandering the desolate English countryside they happen upon a quaint pub with a mysterious patron who warns them not to leave the road when walking after dark. Ignoring such advice (as characters in horror films always do), the two inevitably find themselves lost in the moors being circled by a strange beast who attacks and kills Jack. David wakes up in a London hospital with nasty scratch wounds to his cheek and shoulder, and Jack soon appears, freshly deceased and rapidly decomposing, to deliver the grim news that David will in fact turn into a werewolf the next full moon. David dismisses the encounter as a hallucination, but all indications point to lycanthrope. Cast includes: David Naughton, Jenny Agutter and Griffin Dunne.

results.title: An American tail: Fievel goes west
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Steven Spielberg, Robert Watts, Phil Nibbelink and Simon Wells
results.brief_description: Fievel, the brave young mouse from the much loved “An American tail” returns in this Wild West adventure. Life is hard for the Mousekewitz family who struggle to make ends meet and to keep their dreams alive. Tanya wants to become a singer and Fievel wants to be like his hero Wylie Burp. Lured out West by crafty Cat R. Waul, Fievel uncovers a dastardly plot to turn new settlers into mouse burgers. With the help of his cat friend Tiger and the feared Wylie Burp, Fievel saves the day. Features the voices of James Stewart, John Cleese, Dom DeLuise and Amy Irving with Linda Ronstadt singing the song “Dreams to Dream”.

results.title: An American in Paris
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Arthur Freed and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: An American in Paris tells the story of an ex-GI art student who has fallen in love with a young French girl and then sadly has been parted from her. At their separation he reflects on his feelings towards Paris - the frustration’s, joys and miseries that have been part of his life and his falling in love. Gene Kelly teams up with Leslie Caron in this spectacularly staged musical featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin. Academy Award for Best Film 1951.

results.title: An Affair to remember [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jerry Wald and Leo McCarey
results.brief_description: Debonair playboy Nickie Ferrante (Cary Grant) and beautiful nightclub singer Terry McKay (Deborah Kerr) meet travelling first class aboard a transatlantic luxury liner courtesy of two other people. She is a tycoon’s mistress and he is engaged to an heiress. Their sudden, but undeniable love affair leads them to make a vow - that they will break off their current relationships, get jobs and meet in six months to continue their affair. However, a tragic accident prevents Terry from keeping their rendezvous and the lovers future takes an emotional and uncertain turn. This film is a remake of Leo McCarey’s “Love Story” and Vic Damone croons the title tune on the soundtrack.

results.title: An Actor's revenge
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, Masaichi Nagata and Kon Ichikawa
results.brief_description: Starring Kazuo Hasegawa, a Japanese matinee idol, this is the story of a kabuki actor who plans a long suffering revenge on the men who drove his parents to suicide. A melodrama, this film jumps from the swooning romanticism of the kabuki and its traditional music to stylised action and Hollywood jazz. At the centre of this, Hasegawa brushes aside his advancing years and delivers performances of enduring skill and charm.
